page.title: 18Gas in Kinoulton
page.content: There has been a supply of gas in Kinoulton since{1978-79}but only on the Grange(Wimpey)Estate serving 112 customers.The gas supply is now being extended as far as the canal, with 1275m of{main}and 70 service pipes.The cost of this will be{Â£50,000. The pipes are made of yellow {polyethylene}and are expected to last for as long as needed.The main pipes come from Saxondale to Cropwell Bishop to Kinoulton. Gas workmen are slotting some of the new pipes through the old water main. More people will be able to choose gas as a source of energy. Workmen have been digging up the road and this has caused a traffic problem.{Traffic lights}have been in operation to keep the traffic moving.
